DataElement.preferredDefinition: the reason any treatment, as intervention for management of a malignant neoplasm that is not specified in the clinical protocol guidelines, was administered.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the any treatment administered as intervention for management of a malignant neoplasm that is not specified in the clinical protocol guidelines.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Treatment not specified in a protocol.:Any intervention for management of a malignant neoplasm.

Concepts.definition: Treatment not specified in a protocol.
Any intervention for management of a malignant neoplasm.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the explanation of the cause or action that required non-protocol cancer therapy was administered..

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

PermissibleValues.value: Adjuvant cancer therapy for primary cancer

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any companion treatment given to treat a malignant neoplasm.
Any therapy administered to treat a malignant neoplasm that has spread to other parts of the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any therapy administered to treat a new malignant neoplasm.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Treatment for local or regional recurrence
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any therapy administered to treat a local or regional recurrence

Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cancer that is increasing in scope or severity.

Concepts.definition: A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).: A problem that occurs when treatment affects healthy tissues or organs. Some common side effects of cancer treatment are fatigue, pain, nausea, vomiting, decreased blood cell counts, hair loss, and mouth sores.: Any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of, or because of, another disease, treatment, or procedure.

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

The term was used in various ways in the past, to describe unintended effects of medical intervention, usually negative (unfavourable), but also positive (favourable) ones. It is recommended that this term no longer be used and particularly should not be regarded as synonymous with adverse event or adverse reaction.
Any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of, or because of, another disease, treatment, or procedure.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Symptomatic Disease or Disorder Clinical Deterioration

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Symptomatic Disease or Disorder Clinical Deterioration
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Having to do with symptoms, which are signs of a condition or disease.: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.: A symptom or state of reduced quality or strength.

Concepts.definition: Exhibiting the symptoms of a particular disease.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.
A symptom or state of reduced quality or strength.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

Concepts.definition: An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.
